html:
Etymology[edit]

Found in Late Latin. From ex- +‎ caldus, calidus.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ekˈskal.doː/, [ɛkˈs̠kaɫ̪.d̪oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ekˈskal.do/, [ɛkˈskal̪.d̪ɔ]

Verb[edit]

excaldō (present infinitive excaldāre, perfect active excaldāvī, supine excaldātum); first conjugation

  1. I wash or bathe in warm or hot water.

Descendants[edit]

  • Anglo-Nomran: eschalder, escalder
  • Aromanian: ascaldu, ascãldari
  • Catalan: escaldar
  • English: scald
  • French: échauder
  • Friulian: scjaldâ, sčhaldâ
  • Galician: escaldar
  • Italian: scaldare
  • Occitan: escaudar
  • Old French: eschalder
  • Portuguese: escaldar
  • Romanian: scălda, scăldare
  • Spanish: escaldar

References[edit]

  • excaldo in Charlton T. Lewis and Charles Short (1879) A Latin Dictionary, Oxford: Clarendon Press
  • excaldo in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
